scenario_text.value: Dammit, no! How can weaklings like these...

Garurumon...
Actually, you understand, don’t you?
What?

There is a reason why you cannot access the
full power within. You deny your own heart.

You thought that you were betrayed,
so you were hurt.

But did he really betray you?
Are you sure you want vengeance?

Your heart isn’t in it, no matter how much
you say you need revenge.
Silence! Silence silence SIIILENCE!!!

He betrayed me! Without a doubt!
He left me behind!

Hey now! So you were lonely after you were
left here, right?

But isn’t your loneliness proof that you
cannot fully hate him?
What?

I don’t know what happened, but did you
consider how he must have felt?

Here’s what I think.
If you tell him how you feel...

And if you hear how he feels, you might be
able to understand each other.

For us, our destiny is to reflect the hearts
of the humans we are bound to.
Get real. You know nothing.

But why does my head spin when I talk to all
of you?

(I think Garurumon is on the brink of
a breakthrough.)

(What happened between them?
We still don’t know.)

(Garurumon really wants to hate him, but
there is no real hatred there.)
(What can I say?)
We need a truce.
He’s on your side.
Believe in destiny.
We need a truce.

We need a truce, Garurumon.
We need to think hard about this.

How do you really feel? What do you want to
do? Do you really hate the professor?
Listen to this snot-nosed kid!
He’s on your side.

The professor is on your side, Garurumon.
Hatred is pointless.

If you bury your differences, I know you can
be friends again.

You think you’re so clever.
But there’s nothing more to be done.
Believe in destiny.

You need to believe in your destiny,
Garurumon.

I don’t know what happened between you two...
But think hard. Do you really want revenge?
I... Destiny, bonds... I...
All right, enough. That’s enough.

I can try to deny it, but I lost.
To this delusion of yours that you call bonds.
